atk-s0502a2:90_5: ‘When I want to disembarge, I walked around the shadow of the earth, folded up, and laid down in the air. She doesn’t obstruct the nearby waste-cloth, the buffalolumn tree, the joined palms of mine.’
atk-s0502a2:91_0: ‘I have drunk on all sides, thinking,
atk-s0502a2:92_0: “May you not go for refuge to me and that I have gone for refuge!’
atk-s0502a2:93_0: He then listened to me, thinking, ‘It’s good, sir, to get for refuge!’ Then he reconciles it, thinking, ‘Great king, this is my refuge. Now we take refuge in the Buddha, the teaching, and the Saṅgha.’
atk-s0502a2:96_0: You go for refuge to the Buddha, and to the teaching and to me.’
atk-s0502a2:97_0: King Bimbisāra says, “I’ve heard what he said,” “I won’t feel like,” and so he added: ‘I’ll recite this matter.’
atk-s0502a2:98_0: ‘I have served my even more quarters.
atk-s0502a2:99_0: “May you not go for refuge to me and that I have gone for refuge!’
atk-s0502a2:9_0: Recollecting mother and father, he summoned those sons and said,
atk-s0502a2:9_1: He then summoned a child, a son of a bondservant, a worker, and a wanderer. There is a vast initiate as a father, a son of the Sakyans, and a grabbing him. Then he sends me out of the herd, saying: ‘Give me this, General Sīha, complete in Vāsabha.’
atk-s0502a2:9_10: ‘Having been included in the mark of a human being, and ʻI’ve gone to a city.’
atk-s0502a2:9_12: ‘I didn’t give you two offenses, but we didn’t give them.
atk-s0502a2:9_13: For we can pay respect, esteem, and be no more.
atk-s0502a2:9_15: I won’t give you any dirt.’
atk-s0502a2:9_17: She then showed him the sound of her child.’ Then he left the crowd, thinking,
atk-s0502a2:9_18: And they plagued the rejoicing and recognizeed it, opened the door, and opened the dust blown away.
atk-s0502a2:9_2: And what did he say was the prince.
atk-s0502a2:9_3: ‘I’m sitting on the bank of the river Aciravatī, while sitting on this rugged mountain to your back, and while standing behind your back,’ then offered you a seat.’
atk-s0502a2:9_4: After bowing down to his mother and father, he sat on the bank of the elephant daggling, and snagged behind them.
atk-s0502a2:9_5: ‘Because I’m filled with wisdom, but my son hold of my children.’
atk-s0502a2:9_6: When he heard that elephant trainer, they were all haremed with elephants.’
atk-s0502a2:9_7: ‘Here the old elephant trainer, returns too late in the elephant wood!’
atk-s0502a2:9_8: ‘That’s too far away! Let’s turn back the elephant trainer!’ and they returned to turn back.
atk-s0502a2:9_9: So many maidens and foul, staying on a distance for many thousands, but I thought I’ve already carryed torments.’
